item.name: Projects
item.description: Create/update/delete requires ADMIN or PROJECT_MANAGER. Listing is filtered to the viewer's assignments unless ADMIN/PROJECT_MANAGER.

item.name: Tickets

request.description: Filters are optional; results are limited to tickets the viewer can see.
Admins can override `requesterId`; other roles default to the viewer. Assignees must already be assigned to the project.
Only admins/project managers/requesters/assignees (or developers on their own tasks) can update. Admins alone can change the requester.

item.description: All endpoints require authentication; controllers enforce fine-grained permissions based on role, requester/assignee, and project membership.

item.name: Ticket Assignees
item.description: Manage ticket-level assignees. Non-admins must provide `ticketId` when listing.

item.name: Comments
item.description: Comment permissions follow ticket visibility; only admins or the author (PM/Developer) can edit/delete their own comments.

item.name: Attachments

request.description: Returns attachments with a base64 payload.
Form-data upload: `file` is the binary, `ticketId` is text.

item.description: Uploads are limited to 5MB. Admins can list all attachments; others must provide a ticketId.

item.name: Notifications

request.description: Recipients can mark UNREAD -> READ; admins can set any state.

body.raw:
{
  "recipientId": 3,

  "emailText": "You have been assigned to ticket #1.",
  "state": "UNREAD",

item.description: Non-admins only see their own notifications. Admin-only: create/update/resend/delete. Recipients can mark their own notifications READ.
